snippet: The first volume in a set of Robert Frost’s correspondence is expected to renew debate about his character, which has taken a hit from some scholars.
abstract: Harvard University Press is set to begin publishing The Letters of Robert Frost, four-volume work that is expected to renew debate about the poet's character; editors say letters will paint a far more subtle and well-rounded portrait of a tremendously influential figure who was portrayed as a 'monster of egotism' in landmark Lawrence Thompson biography decades earlier.
lead_paragraph: The first volume in a set of Robert Frost’s correspondence is expected to renew debate about his character, which has taken a hit from some scholars.

headline.seo: Volume of Robert Frost’s Letters Renews Debate About His Character
headline.main: The Road Back: Frost’s Letters Could Soften a Battered Image
headline.print_headline: The Road Back: Frost’s Letters Could Soften a Battered Image
